title: ISic020602. ISic020602
body:
1Ρεσες ανιρες β [---]

1Reses Anires b[---]

1ΡΕΣΕΣΑΝΙΡΕΣΒ[---]

1RESESANIRESB[---]

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text after Manganaro 1961

translation

Valentina Mignosa

Reses Anires.

commentary

The inscription has been interpreted by all editors as an onomastic formula. It is on a fragment of a tile found in contrada Mendolito together with another one apparently written by the same hand. The two documents were initially interpreted as two funerary inscriptions (Manganaro 1961b, 110), then as a single votive inscription dedicated by magistrates to deities (Pisani 1964, 127; Whatmough 1968, 576-577; Ribezzo 1923, 224) and more recently (Cultraro 2005) as a single inscription on the roofing slabs of a building (a house, or more likely a 'public' building) that would bear the dedication of a member of the community financing the structure. Whether these are parts of the same inscription is, however, difficult to prove due to the lack of specific details on the archaeological context and a connection - if not palaeographic - between this inscription and the other one, that bears a formula interpreted as 'gift of' + the name of the donor. The alphabet is the typical one of Sikel inscriptions from the Etna area. Worthy of note, in particular, is the presence of the arrow-shaped alpha, the digamma (with value of v, see also ISic003364).

  • Manganaro 1961, 110, pl. 54.1 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002677
  • Schmoll 1968 18 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002568

  • Agostiniani 1980-1981 516 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002522
  • Ribezzo 1923 224 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001459
  • Pisani 1964 576 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002384
  • Cultraro 2005 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002386
  • Agostiniani 2009 117 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002427
  • Pelagatti 2009 22 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002429
